column4: hello everyone, I'd need some help with dual booting windows 7 and ubuntu 10.10 on a pc with aptio bios (supposed to be an uefi), i'm fairly new to dualbooting (only ever used linux on my pc since 2007 lol) only thing i know is that since 9.10 it's a pain to do due to grub2 and id like to avoid having to "bootrec /fixboot" everytime i need windows, would grub-legacy work on aptio bios?
What about it is supposed to be more difficult?
what you mean?
You said that it is supposed to be a pain in the ass to dual boot now.
I dual boot with no hassle, unless I am missing something specific to do with the bios you mentioned...
i didnt say ass tho =P, but yes, my last attempts failed, windows wouldnt boot, would go to windows logo and restart my pc
What did you install fist?

windows then ubuntu, ubuntu boots flawlessly, but if i use it (update and do what i have to) and then restart and switch to windows it wont boot unless i run windows dvd and "chkdsk && bootrec /fixboo"
Wow... Okay... This might be a bit beyond me, as I have not had that kind of issues at all...
bios doesn't matter, it would have if i had to use grub legacy, did you use grub2?
I'm guess I did as that is the fefault no?
would i be too invasive if i asked you what bios and pc brand you re using?
I think your knowledge surpasses mine too lol. Not sure where to start with hellping you.
Oh gosh we're talking about i7's... Nice...
if you did it with no pains it may be my crappy pc (i havent even touched the aptio one yet)
Rude & intrusive I think would be better words to fit... & no it wouldn't lol.
It's an EVGA 680i.
How old is your machine?
what the hell? i never heard of those lol, and its a '10 dell laptop
EVGA 680i is a 2007 board I think... It's good. Does everything I need.
As to your 10" Dell... What is the HD size?
Could you be having partition issues?
yes no doubt it does everything i was just pointing out my ignorance lol
No I know, I was just explaining lol.

I'm not sure, as i said i havent touched it yet, but on a compaq presario cq60 it wouldn't dualboot and it uses phoenix bios which (its not relevant ) is compatible with grub-legacy, while im not sure aptio is
Windows isn't happy if there isn't enough extra space around the install.
it has like 100GB (vista) or 97GB (7)
xp doesnt boot either, same problem, win logo a lil smile then forced reboot (from os)
If you have an XP disc around try that, to test it with [As it is a quicker install time] Then
Have you tried installing the other way around, Linux then Windows...?
Seems like an unlikely long shot I know, but it might work...

only time i dual booted (not even on my pc) was with win xp and ubuntu 8.10 but on my computers i only used linux since i quit xp lol. And yes i tried doing it,  i had to reinstall grub2 both on mbr and on boot partition
That sounds long...
Sorry what is the model you are playing with? So I can google it.

i actually found out that i could use grub legacy to stop all this linux hate from windows but im not sure it would work on ami aptio, model of what? i actually have 2 laptops lol (if you refer to it)
The machine you are trying to dual on right now.
i dont think i need to give you my dell customization (as details) since its supposed to be 1 bios for all but if so just ask
Okay give me a second...
sure thanks btw
I haven't helped you as yet lol...
you just lost around 10 minutes of your life, its enough to say thanks
Lol.
You said that you haven't tried to dual boot on the Vostro?
last message i got was "such a shame what happened to it"
Yeah that was the last.
ye its bad but for all i do on it its more than enough, what one you use?
I play around with DSL from time to time, right now Slitaz is the one I am playing wiht.
So far it is awesome.
That is where I have it now.
as i said i use it only to fix other ppl's computer so no need for mine lol
I have a netbook on it's way hence my looking at other distros again.
Also looking at Arch which so far is a head ache.
if you say please its not lol
Lol I'll try that next time... Please pacman get-update.
lol
you know what netbook you re going to buy?
That is my second tech joke, I think I am now officially a geek...
It's an Asus something, already on it's way.
already on its way == tomorrow some dude may come to your house and say "your netbook is ready"? (sounds much like suse ads lol)
Lol.
i think im sticking with dell, business support is good, if i throw my pc outa the window i can call them say "my pc grown legs and jumped, fix it!" and they will do it
Yeah but that means you have people poking around your machine too... That's not cool.
what you mean? business is tech at home, he cant do nasty stuff lol
1 reason why im limiting my macs to 1, i have no apple stores close to me and support wont let me see what they do, hence no trust lol
I wouldn't want to pay for an apple...
i have 1, its there sitting lol
This is the one. http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834220850
Apple is way to heavily priced, plus they are releasing things more quickly than anyone else too meaning you are always buying old products almost.
that netbooks is great, i see support is way cheaper than dell lol (they charge alot for accidental damage) but, i hope im wrong im not sure video card is going to be fine
and about apple, yes alot overpriced, but rather cool operating system (a well dressed freebsd lol)
I haven't seen a mac since the mid 90's So I can't say what it's like but still I'm not driven to save for one lol.
i am, just for the sake of seeing cats names in my install cd lol, have you checked if your graphic card is supported by nouveau?
No I haven't actually...
Though from some reviews I am seeing, Things are installing by default pretty well.
lol bluetooth 3 and wifi N is awesome
you may have problems with nvidia card, being forced to use integrated one
If it had USB 3. It would have been the complete package.
I will find a way around it when it arrives.
you can either "not install nvidia drivers" (which is supposed to leave u with intel card) or "install nouveau drivers for it" (which is supposed to work as much as nouveau would)
thats all i know since my laptop was supposed to have a nvidia optimus card too and i gone with intel gma hd lol
So wait, you said earlier about saying please to Arch as a joke...  Does that mean you have installed a gui on Arch before?
Thanks for the heads up on that. That will save me some time when I get it.
pretty much a waste of money since nehalem gma isnt that great but whatever lol

you can also google optimus linux  and find out all you need, mainly they ll say its not supported and you'll need to do something (not install drivers or try nouveau, all i found before deciding to go intel lol)
about the gui, there is alot of documentation, or at least there was when i tried
I just hit circles, I got things downloaded obviously, but I can't configure anything.
I was trying to get my uncle online earlier to help me, but he got to busy.
have you checked their documentation? it was long ago but i remember it wasnt that hard, not harder than kde on freebsd -.- (cloning processes lol)
I was going with Awesome WM...
I have some documentation on it for A Vbox VM, as I'm not smart enough to do it without, but my issues was mounting Guest Additions.
actually when i used arch i copyNpasted everything from documentation lol
It's good to know it's not just me.
well if you do it for the first time you re supposed to have troubles
Yeah this is my first time, but I have never managed to install Guess Additions in any Linux host before either.
Which is adding to the pains.
Yeah this is my first time, but I have never managed to install Guess Additions in any Linux host before either. [Was my last]
